title: How to Use the Ctrl+Alt+Delete Command on a Virtual Machine

steps.title: Use a different keyboard shortcut.
steps.content: Use a different keyboard shortcut. When using a remote desktop, there are a few other keyboard shortcuts you can try to do Ctrl + Alt + Del : Windows: Ctrl + Alt + ⇲ End [1] X Research source Ctrl + Alt + Fn + ⇲ End Ctrl + Alt + ⌤ Ins [2] X Research source Mac: Ctrl + ⌥ Opt + → [3] X Research source Fn + Ctrl + ⌥ Opt + → Fn + Ctrl + ⌥ Opt + Del [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open the virtual keyboard on the remote desktop.
steps.content: Open the virtual keyboard on the remote desktop. How you do this varies depending on what operating system you're using: Windows 10 and earlier: Go to Settings > Ease of Access > Keyboard . Toggle on the option that says Use the On-Screen Keyboard . [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Windows 11: Go to Settings > Accessibility > Keyboard . Toggle on the option that says Use the On-Screen Keyboard . [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Mac: Go to System Settings > Accessibility > Keyboard , then turn on the Accessibility Keyboard . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Press the first two keys on your physical keyboard.
steps.content: Press the first two keys on your physical keyboard. On a Windows computer, this is Ctrl + Alt . On a Mac, it's ⌘ Cmd + ⌥ Opt .

steps.title: Press the final key on the virtual keyboard.
steps.content: Press the final key on the virtual keyboard. For Windows, this is Del . On Mac, it's Esc .

steps.title: Click the Actions menu in the top bar.
steps.content: Click the Actions menu in the top bar. Depending on the remote desktop software you're using, you may have an Actions menu. If you do, click it.

steps.title: Click Control Alt Delete in the menu.
steps.content: Click Control Alt Delete in the menu. This will perform the Ctrl + Alt + Delete action on the remote desktop.
